column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Inverell penned 1232 head an increase of 1018 from last week. It was a dearer market for the most part with the regular buyers attending however not all operated.

Weaner steers were 9c/kg dearer with strong competition from restockers.  Conversely heifers sold to a cheaper result of 23c/kg with an input of slightly plainer offerings. Backgrounders pushed light yearling steers to 396c/kg and an increase of 34c/kg. Medium feeders were considerably dearer and resulted in an average of 351c/kg. Restockers were competitive on light yearling heifers with a rise of 10c/kg. Medium weight feeder heifers followed similar category steers to be dearer topping at 306c/kg.

No numbers of grown steers to quote however heavy grown heifers to process sold to a rise of 23c/kg. All cows were dearer the medium weights selling to 208c/kg. The heavy categories to 18c/kg better selling 204c to 235c/kg. Bulls made 248c/kg.

Stephen Adams  MLA
